poem:
### Race to the Bottom

In corridors of power, whispers grow,  
Promises like autumn leaves, swift to blow.  
Face the world, she says, as it dims,  
While shadows dance on fragile limbs.  
Law binds, yet hearts untwist,  
In lands where justice dares to resist.  
Names by law, yet numbers to some,  
In the race where echoes succumb.
